quotes.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck
quotes.content: Happiness is not a state to arrive at, but a manner of traveling.

quotes.author: Anon
quotes.content: On the first day, man created god.

quotes.author: William Pulteney
quotes.content: Never do today what you can put of till' tomorow.

quotes.author: Bertrand Russell
quotes.content: The time you enjoy wasting, is not wasted time.

quotes.author: Stephen Hawking
quotes.content: What was God doing before he made the world? Was he preparing hell for people who asked such questions?

quotes.author: hXcDiedWithHitler
quotes.content: I don't know what tastes better.  The sweet tears of Democrats when I tell them I favor the free-market, gun rights, and the abolishment of welfare and government regulation or the sweet tears of Republicans when I tell them I favor gay-rights, free-speech, secularism, and the abolishment of the War on Drugs and Terror.

quotes.author: J. K. Rowling
quotes.content: If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.

quotes.author: Ron Paul
quotes.content: Has nobody noticed that the authorities can't even keep drugs out of the prisons? How can making our entire society a prison solve the problem?

quotes.author: Ron Paul
quotes.content: Don't steal - the government hates competition!

quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.content: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.

quotes.author: C.S. Lewis
quotes.content: Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive.  It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies.  The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience.

quotes.author: CrimethInc., Expect Resistance: A Field Manual
quotes.content: No one is more qualified than you are to decide how you live; no one should be able to vote on what you do with your time and your potential unless you invite them to.

quotes.author: Carl Sagan
quotes.content: The nuclear arms race is like two sworn enemies standing waist deep in gasoline, one with three matches, the other with five.

quotes.author: George R.R.  Martin, A Game of Thrones
quotes.content: Bran thought about it.  'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him.

quotes.author: Joseph Stalin
quotes.content: Death solves all problems - no man, no problem.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.content: If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself.

quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe
quotes.content: I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity.

quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe
quotes.content: Sleep, those little slices of death - how I loathe them.

quotes.author: J. K. Rowling
quotes.content: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen.  The man who never reads lives only one.

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: There is only one god and his name is Death.  And there is only one thing we say to Death: 'Not today'.

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: Why is it that when one man builds a wall, the next man immediately needs to know what's on the other side?

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: Her cunt became the world.

quotes.author: Edsger Dijkstra
quotes.content: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.

quotes.author: Nick Black
quotes.content: ...if you aren't, at any given time, scandalized by code you wrote five or even three years ago, you're not learning anywhere near enough.

quotes.author: Heraclitus
quotes.content: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

quotes.author: Francis Underwood
quotes.content: A heartbeat away from the presidency, and not a single vote cast in my name.  Democracy is so overrated.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.content: Everything in the world is about sex except sex.  Sex is about power.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.content: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.

quotes.author: Louis Pasteur
quotes.content: Fortune favors the prepared mind.

quotes.author: Epicurus
quotes.content: Death is nothing to us.  When we exist, death is not; and when death exists, we are not.

quotes.author: Epicurus followers gravestones
quotes.content: Non fui, fui, non sum, non curo (I was not; I was; I am not; I do not care).

quotes.author: Fernando Pessoa
quotes.content: To narrate is to create, for living is just being lived.

quotes.author: Jacob Hornberger
quotes.content: If you are not free to choose wrongly and irresponsibly, you are not free at all.

quotes.author: Frédéric Bastiat
quotes.content: The state is that great fiction by which everyone tries to live at the expense of everyone else.

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: No one will be alive by the last book.  In fact, they all die in the fifth.  The sixth book will be just a thousand-page description of snow blowing across the graves...

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: When you tear out a man's tongue, you're not proving him a liar, you're only telling the world what you fear he might say.

quotes.author: Jamie Zawinski
quotes.content: Some people, when confronted with a problem, think "I know, I'll use regular expressions." Now they have two problems.

quotes.author: Hilaire Belloc
quotes.content: Whatever happens, we have got the Maxim gun, and they have not.

quotes.author: Fisher Ames
quotes.content: We are to give money of which we have too little for land of which we already have too much.

quotes.author: Aristotle
quotes.content: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.

quotes.author: Søren Kjær
quotes.content: Hvis det er Fakta, saa benægter jeg Fakta.

quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau
quotes.content: Thank God men cannot fly, and lay waste the sky as well as the earth.

quotes.author: Napoleon I of France
quotes.content: You would make a ship sail against the winds and currents by lighting a bonfire under her deck? Excuse me, I have no time to listen to such nonsense.

quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quotes.content: A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.content: Don't worry about your difficulties in Mathematics.  I can assure you mine are still greater.

quotes.author: PEP 20 (The Zen of Python)
quotes.content:
* Beautiful is better than ugly,
 * Explicit is better than implicit,
 * Simple is better than complex,
 * Complex is better than complicated,
 * Readability counts.

quotes.author: Leopold Kronecker
quotes.content: God made the natural numbers; all else is the work of man.

quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway
quotes.content: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk.  That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.

quotes.author: August Vinkel Sørensen
quotes.content: So little is know, so the potential of the QC insn't very earlier derminable.

quotes.author: Edward Robert Harrison
quotes.content: Hydrogen is a light, odorless gas, which, given enough time, turns into people.

quotes.author: Edward Robert Harrison
quotes.content: Given enough time, hydrogen starts to wonder where it came from, and where it is going.

quotes.author: Bernard Chazelle
quotes.content: The plethora of programming languages reveals how so many ways there are of signifying the same thing.  (Just as the plethora of political speeches reveals how so many ways there are of signifying nothing.)

quotes.author: Homer Simpsons
quotes.content: Oh Marge, cartoons don't have any deep meaning.  They're just stupid drawings that give you a cheap laugh!

quotes.author: Bernard Chazelle
quotes.content: To be P or not to be P, that is NP's question.

quotes.author: Bernard Chazelle
quotes.content: To produce randomness can be quite arduous.  To this day, only two methods have been scientifically validated.  One of them is the infamous "Kitty Flop."  Strap buttered toast to the back of a cat and drop the animal from a PETA-approved height: if the butter hits the ground, record a 1; else a 0.  For more bits, repeat.  Randomness results from the tension between Murphy's law and the feline penchant for landing on one's feet.  The other method is the classical "Coriolis Flush."  This time, go to the equator and flush the toilet: if the water whirls clockwise, your random bit is a 1; else it's a 0.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.content: The most incomprehensible thing about the universe is that it is comprehensible.

quotes.author: Voltaire
quotes.content: This agglomeration which was called and which still calls itself the Holy Roman Empire was neither holy, nor Roman, nor an empire.

quotes.author: Anon (maybe Oscar Wilde)
quotes.content: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy.

quotes.author: Lao Tzu
quotes.content: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.

quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson
quotes.content: Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies.

quotes.author: Winston Churchill
quotes.content: It has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all the others that have been tried.

quotes.author: Thomas Edison
quotes.content: We will make electricity so cheap that only the rich will burn candles.

quotes.author: J. Robert Oppenheimer, quoting "The Bhagavad Gita"
quotes.content: If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst at once into the sky, that would be like the splendor of the Mighty One...  I am become Death, the Shatterer of Worlds.

quotes.author: Steve Wozniak
quotes.content: Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.

quotes.author: Meta Economics
quotes.content: It cannot be too strongly emphasized that the heart, rationale and driving force of modern banking is keeping people in debt.  The challenge to banks is to keep the maximum number of people in the greatest amount of debt and with all the security of the nation state's guarantee.

quotes.author: Meyer Rothschild
quotes.content: Give me control over a nation's money and I care not who makes its laws.

quotes.author: Anon
quotes.content: Since writing on toilet walls is neither done for critical acclaim, nor financial rewards, it is the purest form of art.

quotes.author: Blaise Pascal
quotes.content: If I had more time, I would have written a shorter letter.

quotes.author: Evelyn Beatrice Hall
quotes.content: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.

quotes.author: John von Neumann
quotes.content: You insist that there is something a machine cannot do. If you will tell me precisely what it is that a machine cannot do, then I can always make a machine which will do just that!

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.content: Everyone knows that debugging is twice as hard as writing a program in the first place.  So if you're as clever as you can be when you write it, how will you ever debug it?

quotes.author: Rasmus Brygger
quotes.content: Det forlyder, at Dansk Folkeparti på mandag fremsætter et lovforslag, der skal erstatte det arabiske talsystem med vikingeruner i forsøget på at beskytte Danmark mod hvad Martin Henriksen kalder et "knæfald for islamistisk matematik".

quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
quotes.content: An infinite number of monkeys typing into GNU emacs would never make a good program.

quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
quotes.content: Every time I see some piece of medical research saying that caffeine is good for you, I high-five myself. Because I'm going to live forever.

quotes.author: Aristotle
quotes.content: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

quotes.author: septomber32nd
quotes.content: If you're not a warg and you're not a targ, then you're Benjen.

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: And suddenly his cock was out, jutting upward from his breeches like a fat pink mast.

quotes.author: Old Irish Toast
quotes.content: Here's to a long life, and a merry one; a quick death, and an easy one; a pretty girl, and an honest one; a cold beer - and another one

quotes.author: Jeremy Clarkson
quotes.content: Mexico doesn't have an Olympic team... because anyone who can run, jump or swim is already across the border.

quotes.author: Deuteronomy 25:11-12
quotes.content: If two men are fighting and the wife of one of them comes to rescue her husband from his assailant, and she reaches out and seizes him by his private parts, you shall cut off her hand. Show her no pity.

quotes.author: Tom Haverford
quotes.content: Sometimes you gotta work a little, so you can ball a lot.

quotes.author: George R. R. Martin
quotes.content: In real life, the hardest aspect of the battle between good and evil is determining which is which.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.content: In theory, theory and practice are the same.  In practice, they are not.

quotes.author: Mads Ynddal
quotes.content: Egentlig mærkeligt hvordan unisex tøj er til BEGGE køn, men en unidirectional pipe går ikke begge veje?

quotes.author: Lysander Spooner
quotes.content: If taxation without consent is not robbery, then any band of robbers have only to declare themselves a government, and all their robberies are legalized.

quotes.author: Groucho Marx
quotes.content: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies.

quotes.author: Kent Beck
quotes.content: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.

quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quotes.content: Testing shows the presence, not the absence of bugs.

quotes.author: Alexis Carrel
quotes.content: Man cannot remake himself without suffering, for he is both the marble and the sculptor.

quotes.author: Carl Sagan
quotes.content: The absence of evidence is not the evidence of absence.

quotes.author: Lars Pedersen
quotes.content: Det er da klart, hver gang man ser en af de to løgnhalse, så tænker man - Hvad er alternativet? Genialt navn!

quotes.author: Fallout Intro
quotes.content: War, war never changes.

quotes.author: Nathan Young - Misfits
quotes.content: If the priest werent fiddling with you, you were one of the ugly kids.

quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quotes.content: Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy.

quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
quotes.content: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.

quotes.author: Charles Bukowski
quotes.content: My dear, Find what you love and let it kill you. Let it drain you of your all. Let it cling onto your back and weigh you down into eventual nothingness. Let it kill you and let it devour your remains. For all things will kill you, both slowly and fastly, but it’s much better to be killed by a lover. ~ Falsely yours

quotes.author: Henry Ford
quotes.content: Any customer can have a car painted any colour that he wants so long as it is black.

quotes.author: Carl von Clausewitz
quotes.content: War is a mere continuation of politics by other means.

quotes.author: Emma Goldman
quotes.content: If voting changed anything, they’d make it illegal

quotes.author: Scott Aaronson
quotes.content: If P = NP, then the world would be a profoundly different place than we usually assume it to be. There would be no special value in ‘creative leaps,’ no fundamental gap between solving a problem and recognizing the solution once it’s found. Everyone who could appreciate a symphony would be Mozart; everyone who could follow a step-by-step argument would be Gauss; everyone who could recognize a good investment strategy would be Warren Buffett.

quotes.author: Frédéric Chopin
quotes.content: Simplicity is the final achievement. After one has played a vast quantity of notes and more notes, it is simplicity that emerges as the crowning reward of art.

quotes.author: Jack Kerouac
quotes.content: One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple.

quotes.author: Robert Storm Petersen
quotes.content: Statistik er som en lygtepæl. Den er god at støtte sig til, men den oplyser kun begrænset.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.content: You can always judge a man by the quality of his enemies.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.content: The only difference between the saint and the sinner is that every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.

quotes.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
quotes.content: Oh my ass bruns like fire! what on earth is the meaning of this\!- maybe much wants to come out?

quotes.author: Douglas Adams
quotes.content: Philosophers for example argue that they are very much concerned with the problems posed by 'real life': like for instance 'What do we mean by real?' and 'How can we reach an empirical definition of life?' and so on.
